widgets_values:
# LTX-2 Audio to Video Workflow Guide

> ‚ö†Ô∏è **Experimental Workflow** ‚Äî This is a highly experimental workflow. Results are not guaranteed and may vary significantly between runs.

## Overview

This workflow uses **audio files to generate video from a single image**. Rather than text-to-video or image-to-video in the traditional sense, you're providing an audio track that drives the video generation process.

## Resolution Requirements

- **Maximum Resolution:** 1600√ó900 ‚Äî exceeding this limit will produce black videos
- **If your output is black:** Stop your run immediately and reduce the resolution
- **Aspect Ratio:** Your target resolution determines the aspect ratio of the final video, so choose dimensions that match your intended output format

## Audio Requirements

- **Minimum Length:** Your input audio must be at least **48 seconds long**
- **Trimming:** Use the **Audio Crop** node to select which portion of your audio to use
- **Selection Format:** Crop times are displayed in `m:ss` format (e.g., `0:00` to `0:48`)
- **Important:** Ensure your selection is at least 48 seconds long, or the workflow will not have enough audio to complete the full generation
- **Vocal Processing:** The workflow automatically separates vocals from the audio/music, then recombines them for the final output‚Äîthis allows the video generation to react correctly to vocals

## What to Expect

- **Output Duration:** Up to 48 seconds of footage generated through sequential extension runs
- **Progressive Previews:** The workflow sends preview outputs along the way, allowing you to monitor quality and stop early if the generation starts to degrade
- **Variable Results:** Due to the experimental nature, some runs will produce better results than others

## Prompting Tips

Prompting is extremely powerful in this workflow‚Äîand requires careful attention.

### Stay on Subject

If you want the video to remain focused on your subject, **explicitly mention the subject in your prompt**. Without reinforcement, the model may drift away from the original image content.

**Example:**  
If your source image is a woman playing piano, include "woman playing piano" in your prompt throughout.

### Avoid Scene Changes

Describing a different scene in your prompt will often cause the video to **immediately jump to that new scene**, which can break continuity. Be intentional‚Äîif you want smooth, coherent footage, keep your prompt consistent with the source image.

## Workflow Tips

1. **Start with a clear, well-composed source image** ‚Äî The quality of your input image significantly affects output quality
2. **Watch the previews** ‚Äî If you notice the video falling apart (distortion, subject loss, incoherence), stop the workflow rather than waiting for the full 48 seconds
3. **Iterate on prompts** ‚Äî Small prompt changes can produce dramatically different results
4. **Expect experimentation** ‚Äî This workflow rewards trial and error; don't expect perfection on the first attempt

## Summary

| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| Modality | Audio ‚Üí Video (from single image) |
| Max Duration | 48 seconds |
| Generation Method | Extension runs with previews |
| Stability | Experimental |

---

*Remember: This is cutting-edge functionality. Embrace the experimentation and enjoy the creative possibilities!*
- **If your output is black:** Stop your run immediately and reduce the resolution
still image with no motion, subtitles, text, scene change

nodes.title: Model Links
widgets_values:
Guide: [Subgraph](https://docs.comfy.org/interface/features/subgraph)

## Model Links (for Local Users)

**diffusion_models**

- [ltx-2-19b-distilled_transformer_only_bf16.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Kijai/LTXV2_comfy/resolve/main/diffusion_models/ltx-2-19b-distilled_transformer_only_bf16.safetensors)

**vae**

- [LTX2_audio_vae_bf16.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Kijai/LTXV2_comfy/resolve/main/VAE/LTX2_audio_vae_bf16.safetensors)

- [LTX2_video_vae_bf16.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Kijai/LTXV2_comfy/resolve/main/VAE/LTX2_video_vae_bf16.safetensors)

**text_encoders**

- [gemma_3_12B_it_fp8_scaled.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Comfy-Org/ltx-2/resolve/main/split_files/text_encoders/gemma_3_12B_it_fp8_scaled.safetensors)
- [ltx-2-19b-embeddings_connector_distill_bf16.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Kijai/LTXV2_comfy/resolve/main/text_encoders/ltx-2-19b-embeddings_connector_distill_bf16.safetensors)


## Model Storage Location

```
üìÇ ComfyUI/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÇ models/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÇ diffusion_models/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ltx-2-19b-distilled_transformer_only_bf16.safetensors
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ üìÇ text_encoders/
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ gemma_3_12B_it_fp8_scaled.safetensors
‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ltx-2-19b-embeddings_connector_distill_bf16.safetensors
```

## Report Issue

Note: Please update ComfyUI first ([guide](https://docs.comfy.org/zh-CN/installation/update_comfyui)) and prepare required models. Desktop/Cloud ship stable builds; nightly-supported models may not be included yet, please wait for the next stable release.

- Cannot run / runtime errors: [ComfyUI/issues](https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/issues)
- UI / frontend issues: [ComfyUI_frontend/issues](https://github.com/Comfy-Org/ComfyUI_frontend/issues)
- Workflow issues: [workflow_templates/issues](https://github.com/Comfy-Org/workflow_templates/issues)

nodes.title: Enable Video Preview
widgets_values: Select and use Ctrl-B to enable/disable video output preivew

inputs.text: A medium close-up shot features a Caucasian man with a closely shaven head and face, wearing a black baseball cap with "PNTR" in white letters on the front, and a dark grey t-shirt with "JUST DO IT" visible across his chest. A small black microphone is clipped to his shirt collar. He is positioned slightly to the left of the frame, looking intently downwards and to his right, his eyes focused off-camera. His facial expression is one of deep concentration, with his brow slightly furrowed. As he looks down, a quick sniff sound is heard, and then he speaks with a deep male voice and a slightly frustrated tone, saying, "I think it's so bad." The camera remains static throughout, maintaining a shallow depth of field, which keeps the man in sharp focus while the background is softly blurred, revealing a light-colored wall with white wooden shelving or trim, and a partially open white wooden door on the right. After a brief pause, another short, audible sniff is heard. The man then continues to speak, his voice maintaining the same quality, as he states, "So bad. So bad." He elaborates further, emphasizing his point with a final statement, "This got to be, it's got to be the worst tool I've ever seen."
